climbs.name: The Woodshed
climbs.fa: Mike Paul & Todd Gordon, 1970's  FFA (TR): Dan Goodwin, 1982 (?)  FL: Jonny Woodward, 9/87

content.description: This is another much neglected climb, but due to its visibility from the parking lot at Split Rocks, and it's relatively accessible difficulty, it should see lots more action. The crack is very exciting and varied. The first bolt is solid, and the first few nut placements are excellent as well and easy to place. Technical crux is just at the start of the thin crack, but there is a possibility of failure near the top of the block due to the pump from jamming the flaring crack at the top. When I climbed this route, there was no anchor at the top, just a single bolt stud sticking out of the rock with no hanger.
content.protection: Mostly nuts, a #4 metolius was useful up high, down low, one bolt to clip before you reach first nut placement

climbs.name: Stitch in Time
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Steve Parker, and George Burton, February 1993

content.description: Liebacking and steep face moves up a thin crack lead to a wild face crux near the top by a bolt; an excellent route.  It is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
content.protection: mostly thin gear (wired nuts and tiny cams) and one bolt
content.location: This route is at the left end of the wall with Grand Canyon Donkey Trail, and you need to tunnel under a large chockstone to reach it.

climbs.name: Precious Jewell
climbs.fa: Dennis Seely, Alan Bartlett, George Burton, and Steve Parker, February 1993

content.description: This climb involves an exposed lieback/hand traverse, with some jams.  It is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
content.location: This route is at the left end of the wall with Grand Canyon Donkey Trail, and you need to tunnel under a large chockstone to reach it.

content.description: Mule Days starts up some positive holds on a dike before trending up and right on pebbly but very good rock.  Make the thin moves through the next couple bolts before heading up and clipping the final bolt on Grand Canyon Donkey Trail.  Another quality BG route.
content.location:
East Face of the Grand Canyon, right next to

Grand Canyon Donkey Trail

and about 40 feet right of the distinctive Woodshed.

content.description: A vertical 5.10B/C lieback up a loose flake (serious) leads to a delicate stemming sequence (crux) by a bolt.

climbs.name: Grand Canyon Donkey Trail
climbs.fa: Dave Houser and Jan McCollum, December 1978

content.description:
Begin this route by climbing to a high first bolt and then continue up on grainy friction past three more bolts, the last one being above the dike. Bolted anchor/rap on top.

A fun climb that would be even better were the rock higher quality. Still, not a bad route and a recommended climb if in the area and wanting to do a slab route.
content.protection:
4 bolts, bolted anchor/rap (all 3/8")

*

The bolted anchor/rappel is currently missing (October 2018)
content.location:
From the Split Rocks parking area follow the climber's trail west, aiming for a large formation with a diagonal dike running across it.

The route lies on the far right side of the formation and is the first climb encountered when approaching the wall. To the left is

The Woodshed

, an obvious vertical crack starting with face moves.

content.description:
Climb

Midnight Lumber

to the horizontal dike, traverse right along the dike, passing four bolts and climb the upper part of "The Woodshed".
content.protection: Four bolts, thin to medium gear.

content.description: This climb is Friction ala Jtree. Some loose grit makes it a real challenge. Have fun between the second and third bolt. Slopers at the top for pulling over are the ticket to ride. Hone your foot work on this one!
content.protection: 3 bolts in good condition. Include gear to about 3" for anchors.

climbs.name: Dangers of Conformity
climbs.fa: George Burton, Dennis Seely, Alan Bartlett, and Steve Parker, February 1993

content.description: This is a fairly nice steep hand crack that's not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
content.location: This route is at the left end of the wall with Grand Canyon Donkey Trail, and you need to tunnel under a large chockstone to reach it.
